# README 

Name of files in the directory:

1) ELM_code_example.py: Primary python script that precesses data, 
						builds ELM model, 
						print out results, 
						makes csv files, and
						save the built model in a file (file name = ELM_model)

2) load_and_run_the_model.py: 	Runs the saved model and predicts output values for new input data set

3) training_ml_data.xlsx: The primary data with three sheets of data that the ELM_code_example.py uses

4) mock_test_data.xlsx: Mock input values the the load_and_run_the_model.py uses

5) Expected_plot.png: A figure of true output vs predicted output plot for best ELM model that I build on the test dataset (will be different for every model)



How to execute the program in the command line terminal:

1) To run the primary code:
python ELM_code_example.py training_ml_data.xlsx

2) To run the load and run model:
python load_and_run_the_model.py ELM_model data_mock_new_data.xlsx


Expected output:
1) For primary code:
